definitions.definition: To pierce; now generally replaced by transfix.
To attach; to affix; to hold in place or at a particular time.
definitions.example: A dab of chewing gum will fix your note to the bulletin board.

definitions.definition: To mend, to repair.
definitions.example: That heater will start a fire if you don't fix it.

definitions.definition: To prepare (food or drink).
definitions.example: She fixed dinner for the kids.

definitions.definition: To make (a contest, vote, or gamble) unfair; to privilege one contestant or a particular group of contestants, usually before the contest begins; to arrange immunity for defendants by tampering with the justice system via bribery or extortion
definitions.example: A majority of voters believed the election was fixed in favor of the incumbent.

definitions.definition: To surgically render an animal, especially a pet, infertile.
definitions.example: Rover stopped digging under the fence after we had the vet fix him.

definitions.definition: (sematics) To map a (point or subset) to itself.
To take revenge on, to best; to serve justice on an assumed miscreant.
definitions.example: He got caught breaking into lockers, so a couple of guys fixed him after work.

definitions.definition: To render (a photographic impression) permanent by treating with such applications as will make it insensitive to the action of light.
To convert into a stable or available form.
definitions.example: Legumes are valued in crop rotation for their ability to fix nitrogen.

definitions.definition: To become fixed; to settle or remain permanently; to cease from wandering; to rest.
To become firm, so as to resist volatilization; to cease to flow or be fluid; to congeal; to become hard and malleable, as a metallic substance.
Not changing, not able to be changed, staying the same.
definitions.example: Every religion has its own fixed ideas.

definitions.definition: Stationary.
Attached; affixed.
Chemically stable.
Supplied with what one needs.
definitions.example: She's nicely fixed after two divorce settlements.

definitions.definition: Of sound, recorded on a permanent medium.
definitions.example: In the United States, recordings are only granted copyright protection when the sounds in the recording were fixed and first published on or after February 15, 1972.

definitions.definition: Surgically rendered infertile (spayed, neutered or castrated).
definitions.example: a fixed tomcat; the she-cat has been fixed

definitions.definition: Rigged; fraudulently prearranged.
(of a problem) Resolved; corrected.
Repaired
